Key Match Events: Ryan Christie scored the opening goal for Scotland.
Ché Adams scored the second goal for Scotland.
Liam Cooper limped off 12 minutes before full time due to a knee-on-knee collision.
John McGinn assisted Ché Adams' goal.
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland aimed to score several goals against Gibraltar and give playing time to fringe players as part of their preparations for Euro 2024.
Steve Clarke's team is preparing for their Euro 2024 opener against Germany.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Clarke expressed hope that Liam Cooper would recover quickly from his injury.
Clarke mentioned that Tommy Conway, the Scotland Under-21 striker, could receive a late European Championship call-up.
Clarke acknowledged the team's lack of potency against Gibraltar and indicated plans to address it.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Estádio Algarve in Portugal.
The groundsman's dog was notably present during the second half of the match.
